problems.title: Ransom Note (Hash Table)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given two strings ransomNote and magazine, return true if ransomNote can be constructed by using the letters from magazine and false otherwise.
Each letter in magazine can only be used once in ransomNote.
problems.examples:
Example 1:
Input: ransomNote = "a", magazine = "b"
Output: false
Example 2:
Input: ransomNote = "aa", magazine = "ab"
Output: false
Example 3:
Input: ransomNote = "aa", magazine = "aab"
Output: true
problems.constraints:
1 <= ransomNote.length, magazine.length <= 10^5
ransomNote and magazine consist of lowercase English letters.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def canConstruct(self, ransomNote, magazine):

        # Return True if possible, False otherwise
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    ransomNote = data[0].strip()
    magazine = data[1].strip()
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.canConstruct(ransomNote, magazine)
    print("true" if result else "false")

hintsList: Count the frequency of each character in the magazine.
Iterate through the ransom note and decrement the counts. If any count goes below zero, return false.
